name: practicability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being able to be done or put into action: Bankers complained about the practicability of the new rules. Many people have expressed serious doubts about the practicability of the proposed schedule for next year. See
practicable
More examplesFewer examplesA lot of their policies have more political utility than practicability.By 1986 doubts about this timetable's practicability were emerging.You may have what looks like a seriously good idea, but not be sure of its practicability.
